text.p: When using JavaScript for client-side form validation, which is NOT true?

text.span: JavaScript code can inspect DOM element attributes to see what the user typed
JavaScript code can prevent the "Submit" button from submitting the form
Validations that are impractical to perform on client (for example, zip code validation) may still be done on server
It reduces work for the server, since the server doesnt have to repeat validations already performed by JavaScript
